fine_dining.name: Villa Anna
signature_dishes: Seasonal tasting menus focusing on local Uppland ingredients
Gourmet à la carte options with refined presentations
fine_dining.atmosphere: Elegant and intimate setting within a historic boutique hotel
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book well in advance, especially for weekends; mention dietary needs when booking; wine pairings recommended.
fine_dining.local_tips: One of Uppsala's top fine dining experiences, known for high-quality ingredients and service in a beautiful historic building.

fine_dining.name: Dryck & Mat
fine_dining.cuisine_type: Modern European with focus on beverage pairings
signature_dishes: Tasting menus designed around wine or beer pairings
fine_dining.atmosphere: Sophisticated and modern, with a focus on the dining experience
fine_dining.booking_tips: Ideal for wine/beer enthusiasts; specify if opting for tasting menu with pairing; book ahead.
fine_dining.local_tips: Highly regarded for its beverage program and how the food complements it. Check out their adjacent bar 'Sju Flaskor'.

fine_dining.name: Hambergs Fisk
signature_dishes: Classic Swedish seafood dishes (e.g., cured salmon, shrimp salad)
Daily specials based on the catch
fine_dining.atmosphere: Classic bistro feel connected to a fish market/deli
fine_dining.booking_tips: Offers both a restaurant and a deli counter; focuses solely on seafood.
fine_dining.local_tips: An Uppsala institution, evolved from a fishmonger. Renowned for the quality and freshness of its seafood.

casual_dining.name: Stationen
casual_dining.atmosphere: Lively, grand brasserie atmosphere replicating Parisian, London, and Rome stations
casual_dining.booking_tips: Consists of different sections (Paris, London, Rome); specify preference if any.
casual_dining.local_tips: Popular and atmospheric spot located in the historic station house. Great for people-watching.

casual_dining.name: Jay Fu's
casual_dining.atmosphere: Stylish, modern restaurant with an 'Amasian' theme
casual_dining.booking_tips: Located on the top floor of Uppsala Saluhall.
casual_dining.local_tips: Unique fusion concept in Uppsala, offering hearty meat dishes with Asian twists.

casual_dining.name: Peppar Peppar
signature_dishes: Classic Swedish dishes with French influences
casual_dining.atmosphere: Cozy and rustic in a historic brick building
casual_dining.booking_tips: Popular among locals, book ahead for weekends.
casual_dining.local_tips: Long-standing favorite known for its reliable food and charming setting.

casual_dining.name: Aaltos Grill & Garden
casual_dining.atmosphere: Stylish Italian-inspired setting with a focus on the grill, nice garden area
casual_dining.booking_tips: Located in a building designed by Alvar Aalto. Good wine list.
casual_dining.local_tips: Popular for its grilled dishes and pleasant ambiance, especially the outdoor seating in summer.

casual_dining.name: Domtrappkällaren
signature_dishes: Seasonal evening menu with Swedish flavors
casual_dining.atmosphere: Historic cellar vaults near the Cathedral with medieval walls
casual_dining.booking_tips: Unique historical setting; check out the different dining rooms.
casual_dining.local_tips: Dine amidst history in parts of Uppsala's oldest buildings. Known for traditional Swedish fare and a vast wine cellar.

street_food.name: Uppsala Saluhall
specialties: Various food stalls (e.g., fish, cheese, meats)
Cafes and casual eateries (e.g., Jay Fu's upstairs)
Opportunities for lunch or buying local products
street_food.hours: Generally Mon-Sat, daytime hours (check specific vendor times)
street_food.seating: Available within eateries and some communal space
street_food.local_tips: Uppsala's main indoor food market. Good spot for lunch or picking up local delicacies. More upscale than a typical street food market.

street_food.name: Kebab & Falafel Stands
street_food.location: Various locations, often near student areas or transportation hubs
street_food.local_tips: Standard quick and affordable option found throughout the city, popular with students.

coffee_shops.name: Güntherska Hovkonditori & Schweizeri
must_try: Classic Swedish pastries (Princess cake, cinnamon buns)
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Grand, traditional European café atmosphere, historic establishment
coffee_shops.food_options: Extensive range of pastries, cakes, sandwiches, light lunches
coffee_shops.local_tips: An Uppsala institution since the 1880s. Experience a traditional Swedish 'fika' in a historic environment.

coffee_shops.name: Kafferummet Storken
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Quaint, cozy, traditional café with vintage decor
coffee_shops.local_tips: A beloved local spot known for its charming, old-fashioned atmosphere and homemade treats.

coffee_shops.name: Café Linné
coffee_shops.food_options: Pastries, sandwiches, salads, simple hot meals
coffee_shops.local_tips: Famous for its giant cinnamon buns ('Linnébulle'). A classic student hangout near the university.

coffee_shops.name: Uppsala Kafferosteri
must_try: Locally roasted single-origin coffee (espresso or filter)
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Modern, minimalist coffee bar focused on quality coffee
coffee_shops.local_tips: Focuses on high-quality, locally roasted beans. For serious coffee enthusiasts.

bars.name: Terrassen Kök & Bar
bars.atmosphere: Stylish rooftop setting with panoramic views of Uppsala (seasonal)
bars.food_options: Full restaurant menu (often grill-focused in summer)
bars.local_tips: Offers some of the best views in Uppsala, particularly popular in warmer months. Located atop a hotel.

bars.name: O'Connors Irish Pub
signature_drinks: Wide selection of beers on tap
bars.local_tips: Popular spot for watching sports and enjoying a casual pint in a classic pub environment.

bars.name: Bryggeriet Ångkvarn
bars.atmosphere: Modern brewpub setting in a historic industrial building
bars.food_options: Gastropub menu designed to pair with beer
bars.local_tips: Brew their own beer on-site. Offers brewery tours and tastings.

bars.name: Churchill Arms
bars.local_tips: Authentic English pub feel, popular with locals and expats.

food_tours.name: Self-Guided Fika Tour
highlights: Visiting multiple traditional and modern cafes
Sampling different types of coffee and pastries (kanelbullar, princess cake)
Enjoying the relaxed atmosphere of Swedish coffee breaks
food_tours.booking_tips: Create your own tour by visiting cafes like Güntherska, Café Linné, Storken, etc. Fika is about taking a break and socializing.

cooking_classes.name: Swedish Baking Class (e.g., Cinnamon Buns)
what_you_learn: Techniques for making classic Kanelbullar (cinnamon buns) or other pastries
includes: Ingredients, instruction, baked goods to take home
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Check local community centers ('studieförbund') or specialized food studios for occasional classes.

markets.name: Uppsala Saluhall
highlights: Vendors selling cheese, meat, fish, bread, and delicacies
Several lunch restaurants and cafes inside
markets.best_time: Lunchtime or for specialty grocery shopping
markets.local_tips: Uppsala's main food hall, a good place to sample local products or have a quality lunch.

markets.name: Fyristorg Market (Outdoor)
markets.hours: Varies, often Wednesdays and Saturdays (check locally)
markets.local_tips: Traditional town square market experience. Selection varies greatly by season.

summer: New potatoes (Färskpotatis) with dill and herring (Sill)
Chanterelle mushrooms (Kantareller) start appearing late summer
winter: Julbord (Christmas Buffet) - Dec, featuring ham, herring, meatballs, Janssons Frestelse etc.
Pea soup and pancakes (Ärtsoppa och pannkakor) - traditionally on Thursdays
Semlor (Cardamom buns with almond paste and cream) - Jan/Feb before Lent
Hearty stews and root vegetable dishes
